intro: Senecio barkhausioides, commonly known as the Cape York Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
